intro: Antirrhinum tenue, commonly known as the slender toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow or orange-red tubular flowers, which are arranged in racemes. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Antirrhinum tenue is well adapted to rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
